intro: Knautia arvensis subsp. pseudolongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved knautia, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads that resemble small, clustered blooms. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves distinguish it from other members of the species. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
